verses.verse: Is there not an appointed time <WH6635> to man <WH582> upon earth <WH776>? are not his days <WH3117> also like the days <WH3117> of a hireling <WH7916>?
As a servant <WH5650> earnestly desires <WH7602> the shadow <WH6738>, and as an hireling <WH7916> looks <WH6960> for the reward of his work <WH6467>:
So am I made to possess <WH5157> months <WH3391> of vanity <WH7723>, and wearisome <WH5999> nights <WH3915> are appointed to me <WH4487>.

When I lie down <WH7901>, I say <WH559>, When shall I arise <WH6965>, and the night <WH6153> be gone <WH4059>? and I am full <WH7646> of tossings to and forth <WH5076> unto the dawning of the day <WH5399>.
My flesh <WH1320> is clothed <WH3847> with worms <WH7415> and clods <WH1487> of dust <WH6083>; my skin <WH5785> is broken <WH7280>, and become loathsome <WH3988>.
My days <WH3117> are swifter <WH7043> than a weaver <WH708>'s shuttle, and are spent <WH3615> outside <WH657> hope <WH8615>.
O remember <WH2142> that my life <WH2416> is wind <WH7307>: my eye <WH5869> shall no more <WH7725> see <WH7200> good <WH2896>.
The eye <WH5869> of him that has seen <WH7210> me shall see <WH7789> me no more <WH5869>: your eyes are upon me, and I am not.
As the cloud <WH6051> is consumed <WH3615> and vanisheth away <WH3212>: so he that goes down <WH3381> to the grave <WH7585> shall come up no more <WH5927>.
He shall return <WH7725> no more to his house <WH1004>, neither shall his place <WH4725> know him any more <WH5234>.
Therefore I will not refrain <WH2820> my mouth <WH6310>; I will speak <WH1696> in the anguish <WH6862> of my spirit <WH7307>; I will complain <WH7878> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul <WH5315>.
Am I a sea <WH3220>, or a whale <WH8577>, that you set <WH7760> a watch over me <WH4929>?
When I say <WH559>, My bed <WH6210> shall comfort <WH5162> me <WH4904>, my couch shall ease <WH5375> my complaint <WH7879>;
Then you scare <WH2865> me with dreams <WH2472>, and terrify <WH1204> me through visions <WH2384>:
So that my soul <WH5315> chooses <WH977> strangling <WH4267>, and death <WH4194> rather than my life <WH6106>.
I loathe <WH3988> it <WH2421>; I would not live always <WH5769>: let me alone <WH2308>; for my days <WH3117> are vanity <WH1892>.
What is man <WH582>, that you should magnify <WH1431> him <WH7896>? and that you should set your heart upon him <WH3820>?
And that you should visit <WH6485> him every morning <WH1242>, and try <WH974> him every moment <WH7281>?
How long <WH4100> will you not depart <WH8159> from me <WH7503>, nor let me alone until I swallow down <WH1104> my spittle <WH7536>?

I have sinned <WH2398>; what shall I do <WH6466> unto you <WH5341>, O you preserver of men <WH120>? why have you set <WH7760> me as a mark <WH4645> against you <WH4853>, so that I am a burden to myself?

And why do you not pardon <WH5375> my transgression <WH6588>, and take away <WH5674> my iniquity <WH5771>? for now shall I sleep <WH7901> in the dust <WH6083>; and you shall seek me in the morning <WH7836>, but I shall not be.
